newsitem.title: PANAMA: Bladex increases size of Euromedium issue.
newsitem.headline: Bladex increases size of Euromedium issue.

text.p: Banco Latinoamericano de Exportaciones (BLADEX) will increase its Euromedium-term notes (EMTN) program from $750 million to $1.5 billion on Nov. 25, first vice president Christopher Hesketh said Monday.
"There is a lot of demand in the Latin American markets for medium-term funds," he told a news conference.

Panama City-based BLADEX, a leading provider of trade financing and other trade related services in Latin America and the Caribbean, has "grown considerably in the past seven years to $5 billion in total assets," Hesketh said. "Our aim is to continue growing," he added.
As part of the EMTN program, BLADEX will offer a Eurodollar bond issue to international investors in December, he said.
It is a five-year transaction with a coupon of 55 basis points above comparable U.S. treasuries. The issue will be between $50 to $100 million.
